ARABIC: لِلَّهِ مُلْكُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا فِيهِنَّ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدِيرٌۢ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: The kingdom of the heavens and the earth and everything in them belongs to Allah. He has power over all things.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: To God belongs all that is in the heavens and the earth, and His the power over everything.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and all that is in them and He has full power over everything.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: To God belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them and He has power over all things.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: To Allah only belongs the kingship of the heavens and the earth and all that is in them: and He is Able to do all things.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and all that is therein, and He is able to do all things.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Allah's is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and what is in them; and He has power over all things.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: To God belongs the kingdom of the heavens and of the earth, and all that is in them, and He is powerful over everything.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Unto Allah belongeth the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth and whatsoever is therein, and He is Able to do all things.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: The kingdom of the heavens and the earth and everything in them belongs to God: He has power over all things.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Allah's is the dominion of the heavens and the earth and whatsoever Is therein, and over everything He is Potent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: To Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and whatever there is in them, and He has power over all things.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: To Allah doth belong the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and all that is therein, and it is He Who hath power over all things.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and all that is therein, and He is Able to do all things.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: To Allah belongs the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth and what is in them. He has power over all things.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: To God belongs the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth and what lies in them, and He has power over everything.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and whatever is within them. And He is over all things competent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [5:120] To God belongs the kingdom of the heavens and of the earth, the storehouses of rain, vegetation, sustenance and everything else, and all that is in them (wa-mā fīhinna: the use of mā, ‘that’, indicates the predominance of all those non-rational creations); and He has power over all things, including the rewarding of the truthful and the punishing of the liar — He is specifically addressing rational beings, for there is none among them with power over all things. [Consists of] 165 verses, all Meccan except for 20, 23, 91, 93, 114, 141, 151, 152, 153, which are Medinese and which were revealed after [sūrat] al-Hijr.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Unto Allah belongeth the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth) unto Him belong the stores of the heavens and the earth: rain, lands, vegetation, fruits, etc., (and whatsoever is therein) of created beings and marvels, (and He is Able to do all things) creating the heavens and the earth, and bestowing reward and punishment'. And of the surah in which the Cattle is mentioned, which is Meccan and revealed in one bulk with the exception of five verses-three verses beginning from (Say: Come, I will recite unto you that which your Lord hath made a sacred duty for you...) to (This hath He ordained for you, that ye may ward off (evil).) and two verses beginning from (Who does greater wrong than he who invents a lie against Allah...) to (... Where are (now) those partners of your make believe?)-which are Medinan, and it consists of 126 verses, 3,050 words and 12,422 letters: Surah 6: The Cattle (al-An'am) And of the surah in which the Cattle is mentioned, which is Meccan and revealed in one bulk with the exception of five verses— three verses beginning from (Say: Come, I will recite unto you that which your Lord hath made a sacred duty for you...) to (This hath He ordained for you, that ye may ward off (evil).) and two verses beginning from (Who does greater wrong than he who invents a lie against Allah...) to (... Where are (now) those partners of your make believe?)— which are Medinan, and it consists of 126 verses, 3,050 words and 12,422 letters:
